# The `LegalizerInfo.h` File Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

## Description {#details}

Interface for Targets to specify which operations they can successfully select and how the others should be expanded most efficiently.

<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The (vector) operation should be implemented by splitting it into</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// sub-vectors where the operation is legal. For example a &lt;8 x s64&gt; add</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// might be implemented as 4 separate &lt;2 x s64&gt; adds. There can be a leftover</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1334"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// It is an error to request an opcode that has already been requested by the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1335"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// multiple-opcode variant.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1336"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/legalizeruleset">LegalizeRuleSet</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/legalizerinfo/#a32539827696dafee94ee79c3321b4245">getActionDefinitionsBuilder</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Opcode);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1337"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1338"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Get the action definition builder for the given set of opcodes. Use this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1339"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// to define the action definitions for multiple opcodes at once. The first</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1340"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// opcode given will be considered the representative opcode and will hold</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1341"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the definitions whereas the other opcodes will be configured to refer to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1342"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the representative opcode. This lowers memory requirements and very</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1343"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// slightly improves performance.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1344"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1345"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// It would be very easy to introduce unexpected side-effects as a result of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1346"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// this aliasing if it were permitted to request different but intersecting</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1347"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// sets of opcodes but that is difficult to keep track of. It is therefore an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1348"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// error to request the same opcode twice using this API, to request an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1349"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// opcode that already has definitions, or to use the single-opcode API on an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1350"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// opcode that has already been requested by this API.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1351"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/legalizeruleset">LegalizeRuleSet</a> &amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1352"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/legalizerinfo/#a32539827696dafee94ee79c3321b4245">getActionDefinitionsBuilder</a>(std::initializer&#95;list&lt;unsigned&gt; Opcodes);</span></CodeLine>
